== Introduction ==
Ekiga was the default Internet telephony (<nowiki>[[VoIP]]</nowiki>) application/<nowiki>[[SoftPhone]]</nowiki> in Ubuntu until Ubuntu 9.10 (Karmic Koala), when it was replaced by <nowiki>[[Empathy]]</nowiki>. It lets you make audio and video calls over the Internet to people who have hardware or software that follows the <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Session_Initiation_Protocol|SIP]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H.323|H.323]]</nowiki> standards. Ekiga also features basic instant messaging.

Ekiga has a robust and wide support for multimedia, and is compatible with <nowiki>[[Windows Messenger]]</nowiki> and most VoIP applications. Ekiga cannot communicate with <nowiki>[[Skype]]</nowiki> because <nowiki>[[Skype]]</nowiki> uses its own non-standard protocols. If you have a suitable <nowiki>[[SIP provider]]</nowiki>, you can also use Ekiga to place calls to any normal phone line.

During installation of Ekiga, it might be necessary to change router settings.

 <nowiki>[[File:ekiga_3.png]]</nowiki>

----
== Desktop interoperability ==
Ekiga works with Linux or Windows. For Mac OS, you can use the free software <nowiki>[[http://xmeeting.sourceforge.net|xmeeting]]</nowiki>.

Ekiga is compatible with Netmeeting (H.323, windows), Windows Messenger (SIP, Windows), <nowiki>[[Gizmo]]</nowiki> (SIP, multi-platform), and <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ekiga.org/index.php/Ekiga_Interoperability|other programs listed on the Ekiga documentation]]</nowiki>.

----
== Ekiga.net services (free calls PC-to-PC) ==
Ekiga.net is a free service (no ads) based upon Free Software (<nowiki>[[http://www.iptel.org/|iptel]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://www.asterisk.org/|Asterisk]]</nowiki>) ran by the Ekiga team.

----
== Register to a commercial VoIP provider (landline and mobile phones) ==
You can register to a commercial VoIP provider to place calls to normal phone line or cell phone (POTS). Ekiga allows you to register with several <nowiki>[[Ekiga-VoIPProviders|VoIP providers]]</nowiki>.

* See <nowiki>[[Ekiga-VoIPProviders]]</nowiki> - How to register to a commercial VoIP provider.

== Install Ekiga ==

In trusty (14.04) and later, Ekiga is available in the Universe repository.  The package name is ''ekiga''.

=== Install snapshots from the website ===
You can get the latest development snapshots from <nowiki>[[http://snapshots.ekiga.net/|snapshots.ekiga.net]]</nowiki>. Installing them may solve problems you are experiencing, but be aware that the snapshots could also cause more problems. This package will replace your actual and stable version.

 /* <nowiki>[[File:ekiga3_03-19-2008.png]]</nowiki> I don't know why this image is necessary. */

=== Install snapshots using a repository ===

==== Add this GPG key to verify the repository ====
* Add the key to your key list
<pre>
$ gpg --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 3596ED6E
</pre>
* Add the key to apt utils
<pre>
$ gpg --export --armor 3596ED6E | sudo apt-key add -
</pre>

==== Add the repositories ====
* The Ekiga SVN snapshot repository
<pre>
deb http://snapshots.ekiga.net/snapshots/ubuntu/ <release> main
</pre>
* The updates repository (official)
<pre>
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ <release>-updates main multiverse
</pre>

where <release> is the codename of the Ubuntu release used, for example 'natty'.

Optionally you can add more features installing those packages:
* for webcam support using only V4L API: '''libpt-snapshot-plugins-v4l'''
* FireWire camera AVC video support: '''libpt-snapshot-plugins-avc'''
* FireWire camera DC video support: '''libpt-snapshot-plugins-dc'''
* The H264 Video codec: '''libopal-snapshot-plugins-h264'''

==== Install Ekiga Snapshot ====
* Install the package '''ekiga-snapshot'''
